Articles.Content: (Im new to the ksp fourums so tell me if this has been posted here before or is in the wrong place.) So I was trying to make a mod and I watched like a million tutoreals. I made the model and collision mesh in unity. But when I tried to use the part all the parts in the vab where gone and all the stock ships said "locked or invalid parts" this is realy frusterating beacuase ive done every thing right.
This likely cause is a spelling or syntax error in the cfg file.
if all parts disappear in Editor then you've made a mistake(s) along the way. unfortunately with the vague description of your process, no one can tell where you might have made the mistake(s).

Il give you exactly what I did. I made a model and texture in blender. Then exported it to unity and imported part tools. Then set a collision mesh, and copyed a cfg file from the ibeam pocket edition, changed arount the names description attatch rules etc.. and then I tried it and all parts are gone.

This happened to me when I made my first tank. The problem was that I had named it wrong in the first lines and all parts in the VAB were missing. Iirc it was the "module = Part" line that had an error.

This can be caused by a wide range of typos in the CFG file. Even an extra period can cause it (like typing "1.0." instead of "1.0"). Take a close look at all the things you changed in the CFG, and see if you can find extra punctuation, or a garbled number, or something like that.
thanks for the help the problem was a period where a comma should be it works now but there is no texture
To have the texture work you need to use a ksp shader, not that default unity diffuse shader.
